Error metric evaluates at points drawn from the actual data distribution

todos.text: If fitting multiple fields from a single observation, use joint regression (not sequential projection)
Design matrix columns span ALL unknown fields simultaneously
Cross-contamination test: does fitting V alone change when Φ basis is added?
For `L(θ) = θᵀAθ - bᵀθ`: normal equations are `(2A)θ = b`, NOT `Aθ = b`
todos.section: RIGHT: Loss L = θᵀAθ - bᵀθ + C → ∇L = 2Aθ - b = 0 → (2A)θ = b

todos.text: For `L(θ) = (1/2)θᵀAθ - bᵀθ`: normal equations are `Aθ = b` (the 1/2 cancels)
todos.section: RIGHT: Loss L = θᵀAθ - bᵀθ + C → ∇L = 2Aθ - b = 0 → (2A)θ = b

todos.text: Verify by checking: does `L(θ_solved)` < `L(θ_solved ± small perturbation)`?
todos.section: RIGHT: Loss L = θᵀAθ - bᵀθ + C → ∇L = 2Aθ - b = 0 → (2A)θ = b

todos.text: Description is clear and under 200 chars
"When to Use" section with 3+ specific scenarios
**Completeness**: Every cell in the factorial design is filled (or marked missing with reason)
**Consistency**: Same metric format across all tables (%, decimal places, bold convention)
**Reproducibility**: Parameter table lists ALL settings, not just varied ones
**Bolding**: Best values bolded consistently (per-column or per-row, not mixed)
**Analysis**: Every anomaly, failure, and surprising result has an explanation
**Cross-reference**: Tables reference the same experiment IDs/paths for traceability
**Status**: Running/missing experiments clearly marked with ETAs
**Captions**: Each table has a descriptive caption (for LaTeX)
**Test 2-3 sample references**: Verify they pull correct values before building full model
**Column mapping**: Confirm Excel columns match (e.g., column 64 = BL, not BK)
**Row offset**: Remember Excel rows are 1-indexed (DataFrame row 5 = Excel row 6)
**NaN handling**: Check for null values with `pd.notna()`
**Far-right columns**: FY data often in columns 50+
**Multiple matches**: Search all occurrences, not just first
**Division by zero**: Check denominators before using `/` in formulas (#DIV/0!)
**Wrong references**: Verify all cell references point to intended cells (#REF!)
**Cross-sheet references**: Use correct format (Sheet1!A1) for linking sheets
**Start small**: Test formulas on 2-3 cells before applying broadly
**Verify dependencies**: Check all cells referenced in formulas exist
**Test edge cases**: Include zero, negative, and very large values
Verify BOSZ checkpoint path in config
Update config with Stage 1 best checkpoint
Run evaluation script on APOGEE test
Content fills entire page (no large white margins)

todos.text: 数据划分固定且可复现
标签分布检查（是否平衡）
All formulas use proper LaTeX syntax ($...$ or $$...$$)
Each file has clear beginning and ending
Narrative flows smoothly when read aloud
Files are balanced in length and content
Understanding the set of files ≈ understanding the original document
All formulas validated (no code blocks, proper LaTeX syntax)
Each file has clear introduction and conclusion
Narrative reads smoothly when spoken aloud
User could understand original by reading all parts
All sweep values are lists (even for single value: `[42]`)
`results.metric` matches what your training script logs
**Analyze best config**: Load `summary.yaml`, extract best run
Text is large enough (minimum 18pt, ideally 24pt+ for body text)
High contrast between text and background (4.5:1 minimum, 7:1 preferred)
Color scheme is professional and colorblind-accessible
Consistent visual design across all slides
No text overflow or truncation at slide edges
No element overlaps (text over images, overlapping shapes)
Bullets and text are not cut off
Captions and labels are visible and readable
One main idea per slide (not overloaded)
Minimal text (3-6 bullets per slide maximum)
Bullet points are concise (5-7 words each)
Figures are simplified and clear (not copy-pasted from papers)
Data visualizations have large, readable labels
Citations are present and properly formatted
Results/data slides dominate the presentation (40-50% of content)
Clear narrative arc (introduction → methods → results → discussion)
Slide count appropriate for talk duration (~1 slide per minute)
Title slide includes authors, affiliation, date
Introduction cites relevant background literature (3-5 papers)
Results presented logically with clear visualizations
Future directions or broader impact discussed
Summary statement clearly conveys overall assessment
Major concerns are clearly identified and justified
Suggested revisions are specific and actionable
Minor issues are noted but properly categorized
Figures and tables evaluated for quality and integrity
Tone is constructive and professional throughout
Review is thorough but proportionate to manuscript scope
Recommendation is consistent with identified issues
Can describe in 3-4 items or less? (NOT 5+)
Is it a simple workflow (3-4 steps, NOT 7+)?
Can describe all text in 10 words or less?
Does it convey ONE message (not multiple)?
Text small/hard to read → Regenerate with "150pt+"
Less than 50% white space → Regenerate "60% white space"
Multiple cases cramped → SPLIT into separate graphics
NO content cut off at ANY of the 4 edges (check carefully)
Graphics look SIMPLE (not like complex 7-stage workflows)
High-quality image format (PNG from AI generation)
Adequate spacing between all components (AI optimizes)
All arrows connect properly to intended targets
Works in grayscale (tested with accessibility checker)
Text minimum 7-8 pt at final size
All elements labeled clearly and completely
Consistent styling with other figures in manuscript
Comprehensive caption written with all abbreviations defined
Exported in required format for journal (PDF/EPS/TIFF)
Reviewed overlap detection report (zero high-severity overlaps)
Resolution validated at target DPI (300+ for print)
Visual quality report generated and reviewed
All quality reports saved with figure files
Source files (.tex, .py) saved for future revision
Git commit includes source, output, and quality reports
README or comments explain how to regenerate figure
Figure displays correctly in compiled manuscript
Cross-references work (`\ref{}` points to correct figure)
Caption appears on correct page relative to figure
No compilation warnings or errors related to figure
No text overflow or element overlap
All sections present and properly formatted

todos.text: Val MAE on APOGEE labels decreasing
All essential visuals (5-6 core + any additional) are included and render correctly
All data points have sources cited
Table of contents, list of figures, list of tables are accurate
Diagnosis is accurate and properly coded (ICD-10)
Timeline is realistic and clearly defined
D2 syntax + style template content in memory
Every node has exactly 1 class from the standard symbols
Primary flow is clean L→R or T→B, no large detours
Secondary edges labeled; primary edges unlabeled
No orphan nodes (every node has ≥ 1 connection)
**No orphan nodes** — every node has at least 1 connection
**No self-loops** — no edge where source === target
**Every gate has pass + fail** — every DecisionNode has exactly 2 outgoing gate edges
**Edge toggles work** — each category can be independently shown/hidden
**ELK no overlaps** — no nodes overlap after layout
**Detail panel** — every clickable node has metadata in the right sidebar
**4-channel encoding** — every node has: shape (function), color (executor), stripe (stage), halo (if gate)
**Breadcrumb navigation** — drill-down and back navigation works
**3-second scan** — narrate main flow without clicking
**8-10 nodes** — exactly (split if fewer, group if more)
**Primary-only spine** — collapsed view shows ONLY primary flow edges (black 3px)
**Shape compliance** — every node's shape matches its standard symbol type
**Gate pattern** — every expansion follows: dataflow → diamond → pass/fail → output/rework → feedback
**No self-loops** — no edge where source === target
**Content completeness** — N/N source items mapped (0 missing)
**Loop structure clear** — nested containers with labeled headers and count badges
**Parameters visible** — every specific value shown as annotation node
**Code refs present** — every file:Class reference shown as badge
**Comparison branches** — parallel strategies shown as horizontal branches from dispatch
**Standard shapes** — decisions = diamonds, outputs = documents, dispatch = hexagon
**Legend present** — node types, edge types, stage colors documented
**Readable** — all text ≥ 9px, no overlapping nodes, no truncated labels
**Passes `/audit-flowchart`** — including Layer C (Content Completeness) for protocol diagrams
